intro: Leopoldia cycladica subsp. subsessilis, commonly known as the Cycladic leopoldia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
